BMI Categories 
Underweight = smaller than 18.5 
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9 
Overweight = 25–29.9 
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater 

Your weight is at a very low level , it may lead to serious health problems. you do not have enough body fat to sustain good health. 
if you’re underweight, you may be more likely to also be malnourished if your low BMI is caused by an unbalanced diet or an underlying disease that affects nutrient absorption. 

Consider high-protein meals, which can help you to build muscle. Also, choose nutritious carbohydrates, such as brown rice and other whole grains. 

 Underweight and HealthyWeight are classified by an individual’s body mass index (BMI). BMI is measured by dividing a person’s weight by their height squared in metres. The BMI is generally used as a means of correlation between groups related by general mass and can serve as a vague means of estimating adiposity.
